p: Study site: King Khalid University Hospital (KKUH), Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, an 850-bed primary, secondary and tertiary care facility with all general and subspecialty medical services with three intensive care units (ICU) twelve inpatient wards including a cardiology/cardiac surgery ward, a haemodialysis unit (HD) and an emergency room (ER) which has three different units, including a resuscitation unit (RU) with ten beds that is only equipped with one single airborne infection isolation room (AIIR), the remainder beds are separated by curtains. Intervention was part of the standard of care for hospital outbreak management and individual oral consent for nasopharyngeal swabs (NPS) was standard. The study was approved by the hospital's Institutional Review Board (IRB) number: Eâˆ’15-1464.
